metadata.feature_description: Like and unlike wiki articles with like count display

steps.action: Navigate to wiki article 'Published Test Article - Jan 16 2026'
steps.expected: Article page loads with Like button visible
steps.actual: Article page loaded successfully with 'Like this' button visible in the action toolbar

steps.expected: Article is liked and button changes to 'Unlike this'
steps.actual: Button changed to 'Unlike this' and 'You like this' text appeared below the article content

steps.action: After liking the article, observe the like indicator
steps.expected: Like count or like status is displayed
steps.actual: 'You like this' text is displayed below the article content, confirming the like was registered

steps.action: Click the 'Unlike this' button on a previously liked article
steps.expected: Article is unliked, button changes back to 'Like this', and like indicator is removed
steps.actual: Button changed back to 'Like this' and 'You like this' text was removed from the page

steps.action: Verify the like indicator is no longer visible
steps.actual: Confirmed - no 'You like this' text visible after unlike action

steps.expected: Article is liked with 'You like this' displayed
steps.actual: Article liked successfully with 'You like this' text visible

steps.action: Refresh the page by navigating to the same URL
steps.expected: Like state persists - button should show 'Unlike this' and 'You like this' should be visible
steps.actual: After page refresh, the button still shows 'Unlike this' and 'You like this' text is still displayed, confirming the like state is persisted in the database

observations: Code review shows Like functionality is delegated to the Social Library's socialController.like() and socialController.unlike() methods in dnn.wiki.Article.js
User points increased from 197 to 202 after liking, suggesting the scoring/reputation system is integrated with the Like feature (though not explicitly tested as a separate scenario)
The Like button uses dnnSocialLike CSS class and toggles to dnnSocialLikeActive when liked
The UI shows 'You like this' text below the article content when the current user has liked the article
